Class QuizApiService

Represents a service for making HTTP requests to a quiz API. This service supports basic CRUD operations (CREATE, READ, UPDATE, DELETE), handles exceptions and responses, and manages the authorization. Includes methods for handling HTTP POST, GET, PUT, DELETE operations, as well as handling exceptions.

GetAsync<T>(String, String)

Sends an asynchronous GET request to the specified URI with the given authentication token. This method expects to receive a JSON payload in response which it will attempt to deserialize into an instance of type T. In addition to the deserialized data, the method will also return an ApiResponse object containing HTTP status code, flags indicating success or failure, as well as relevant error messages, if any.

Declaration
public async Task<ApiResponse<T>> GetAsync<T>(string uri, string authToken)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String uri

The endpoint to which the GET request will be sent.
System.String authToken

The authentication token to be included in the request headers.
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<ApiResponse<T>>

An ApiResponse object containing the HTTP status code, flags indicating success or failure, a relevant error message, if any, and the deserialized data.
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

The type into which the JSON response will be deserialized.
Exceptions
Type Condition
Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReaderException

Thrown when there is an error reading the returned JSON.
System.Exception

Thrown when a general error occurs in deserialization.

HandleException<T>(Exception)

Handles exceptions by creating and returning an ApiResponse with Success set to false, Message set to the exception message, and Status set to InternalServerError.

Declaration
public static ApiResponse<T> HandleException<T>(Exception ex)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Exception ex

The exception to handle.
Returns
Type Description
ApiResponse<T>

A new ApiResponse with Success set to false, Message containing the exception message, and StatusCode set to InternalServerError.
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

The type parameter of the ApiResponse.

HandleExceptionWithNoData(Exception)

Handles exceptions with no data and logs the exception message. Returns an ApiResponseWithNoData with the error message and status code as Internal Server Error.

System.Exception ex

Returns

ApiResponseWithNoData

Returns an instance of ApiResponseWithNoData with the error information.

PostAsync<T>(String, Object, String)

Performs an asynchronous HTTP POST request to the specified URI with the provided data. An optional authToken can be used for authenticated requests. The returned ApiResponse object includes status code, message, success and data of type T.

Declaration
public async Task<ApiResponse<T>> PostAsync<T>(string uri, object data, string authToken = "")
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String uri

The URI for the HTTP request.
System.Object data

The data to be sent in the HTTP POST request.
System.String authToken

(Optional) The authorization token for authentication.
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<ApiResponse<T>>

A Task resulting in an ApiResponse object, containing response status code, message, success, and the response data of type T.
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

PostAsyncWithNoData(String, String)

Asynchronously sends a POST request to the specified URI with an authentication token. This method does not expect any data in the response body.

Declaration
public async Task<ApiResponseWithNoData> PostAsyncWithNoData(string uri, string authToken)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String uri

The URI to which the POST request will be sent.
System.String authToken

The authentication token to be included in the request header.
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<ApiResponseWithNoData>

If the request is successful, returns an ApiResponseWithNoData object containing the status code and parsed error message. In case of an exception, it handles the error and returns an ApiResponseWithNoData object.
| Improve this Doc View Source

PutAsync<T>(String, Object, String)

Sends a PUT request asynchronously to a specified URI as an asynchronous operation.

Declaration
public async Task<ApiResponse<T>> PutAsync<T>(string uri, object data, string authToken)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String uri

The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the web resource to which the data will be sent.
System.Object data

The object to be sent to the target URI.
System.String authToken

The authentication token to use in the request.
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<ApiResponse<T>>

A task that represents the asynchronous operation, which wraps the HTTP response from the server. The System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1.Result property returns an ApiResponse object that contains the server response.
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

The type of the object to send.
